tables.title: Table_3_1_4_6_Offset_1Ch_CSTS_Controller_Status
tables.table_md:
| Bits | Type | Reset¹ | Description | | :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- | | 31:07 | RO | 0h | Reserved | | | | | **Shutdown Type (ST):** If CSTS.SHST is set to a non-zero value, then this bit indicates the type of shutdown reported by CSTS.SHST.
If this bit is set to '1', then CSTS.SHST is reporting the state of an NVM Subsystem Shutdown and this bit remains set to '1' until an NVM Subsystem Reset occurs.
If this bit is cleared to '0', then CSTS.SHST is reporting the state of a controller shutdown.
An NVM Subsystem Reset shall clear this bit to '0'. All other Controller Level Resets shall not change the value of this bit.
If CSTS.SHST is cleared to 00b, then this bit should be ignored by the host. | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | |
